description: Composite numbers n such that (n!/n#)+1 is prime, where n# = primorial numbers A034386.
comments: Note that n!/n# is known as n compositorial.Subset of A140294. Prime numbers are excluded since n!/n# = (n-1)!/(n-1)# when n is prime. - _Giovanni Resta_, Mar 28 2013a(23) > 14000. - _Giovanni Resta_, Apr 02 2013a(25) > 50000. - _Roger Karpin_, Jul 07 2015
author: Paul Jobling (paul.jobling(AT)whitecross.com)
